reviews.text: The hotel is in a leafy residential neighborhood that's a short walk from the lively English Bay Beach area, and all the restaurants and shop along Denman Street. The exterior of the building is quite nice, and the interior hallways are very nice, including hardwood floors. It's also quite near Stanley Park. I thought the location was excellent. However, it is a bit of a hassle to get to the heart of downtown and Gastown -- it's a bit too far to walk, so you'll have to rely on public transport or taxis. Staff is very friendly and helpful in getting around town.
reviews.title: Good budget option, nice neighborhood
Just what we wanted!
reviews.text: Let's make it clear -- this is a budget hotel. The rooms are pretty spartan, and the carpet and some of the amenities are a little bit worn. Also, there's no air conditioning, which can make things quite warm during hot stretches. (Which, are uncommon along the B.C. coast, it should be noted.) Rooms were pretty clean, though, and the hotel had a nice sitting room and storage for bags and bikes.
It's not the Hilton, but it also doesn't have the prices of the Hilton.
reviews.title: Met expectations perfectly!
Terrible,Awful Baaaaaaaaaaad
reviews.text: We always approach a budget hotel holding our breath. All we knew was that this was a great location. The reality: our room was on the main floor toward the back, a great advantage because of proximity to the comfortable living room -- not lobby, living room: fire in fireplace, comfortable couches, good light to read by, guidebooks and reading books on shelves, the day's newspapers, coffee and hot water all day and night. The room was basic but just what we needed, clean and comfortable. The wide hallway with historic photos of Vancouver was spacious and welcoming. The people were courteous and helpful. Even the parking worked out (the hotel doesn't provide parking but gives good advice where to find it.) So no hesitation in recommending this hotel to people looking for good value and basic comfort. (Note: bring your cell phones; pay phone in the lobby, but no phone in the room.)

Vancouver recently served as the staging area for an extended camping vacation in British Columbia with my two teenage sons. I was looking for an inexpensive hotel near English Bay. I can't remember the exact words, but the tour book I used described the Buchan Hotel as a clean, no-frills, budget hotel, with a great location. That's exactly what I was looking for, and that's exactly what I found.
reviews.title: Astounding value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Buchan has a great location -- a quiet neighborhood off of Denman Street, with all its restaurants -- but I wouldn't want a prolonged stay there. Our room was small with cheap furniture, but at least it was clean -- just shabby and dreary. We had the smallest bathroom imaginable!
reviews.title: Affordable but basic accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is significantly more affordable than most choices in the area. The property is in a great location..about a block and a half to Stanley Park and the waterfront and only a few blocks to the shopping areas on Denman and Robson streets. The hotel furnishings are outdated and the toilet sounds like an engine (have never run across this before). They have both shared and private baths and there is a small living room with coffee, etc. by the entrance. Overall a good bet if you are up for saving money and not going to spend much time in your room.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relatives in Vancouver suggested we book a room here due to its price range and location near Stanley Park, eateries, etc. The location was great. Lots of eateries, gelato shops, 2 blocks to the Park, close to shopping and other conveniences for a traveler including banks, markets, UPS counter to ship back extra items we didn't want to carry back home.
reviews.title: No elevator or A/C but just the right location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 47, one flight up from the lobby which is already up a short flight of steps from the street. There is no elevator (unexpected, the topic never came up) and luckily we were able to manage our bags. We're a physically fit middle-aged couple from NYC. The $98/night room with private bath didn't have A/C. There was a ceiling fan which helped but we seemed to have arrived during an unusual hot spell. The bathroom was tiny and yet it had the basics. However, I wondered about the accomodations for individuals who are larger than we are. We are both under 5'7" and slender.The overall room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The reception desk personnel were friendly. There is a restaurant downstairs, but not part of the property.
reviews.title: Located in heart of downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got what we were seeking: a low cost but clean room in a safe location in a lively neighborhood. We spent most of our time out, of course. Casual Asian places were geared towards younger people (music) but the food was tasty and well cooked. There is a nearby breakfast place called White Spot which provides eggs, breakfast meats, toast, coffee, etc. for under $5.00. We enjoyed our city visit!
reviews.title: Great value and location
Awful!
reviews.text: I love a good bargain too, but this place was no bargain. It was plain awful. The first sign that this was not going to be a pleasant experience was the overwhelming smell as you enter the lobby. The room was tiny and everything in it was at least 60 years old. No phone, no hairdryer, etc. The tub had so much mildew in it, I wouldn't have worn bare feet in it. While the staff was very friendly and the location is great, I couldn't bring myself to even stay there for one night. The only redeeming part of this whole disaster was the fact I was only charged half of one night's rate for leaving after 2 hours.

reviews.title: Great location....I'll be back.
reviews.text: For most of what I wanted to do, the Buchan was ideally situated. Easy walk to most anywhere in westend Vancouver. Lots of cheap bike rentals a block away, great food on Denman, Stanley Park is practically in the backyard and yet peaceful and quiet. Sure the rooms are basic but you get what you pay for. They were clean, staff friendly and the bed coomfortable. I'll go back.

reviews.title: Delightful location!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Buchan Hotel with a large group of friends (Singles On Sailboats) who flew in and chartered 8 boats to sail the Gulf Islands. The day we flew in was quite warm, 9/5, and there is no air conditioning - some rooms had fans. There also is no elevator and hauling bags and sailing gear up to the second or third floor was a nuisance. However, the rooms were clean and the windows did open - and the location, just a couple blocks from everything, was fabulous. There is no food service but the restaurant in the lower level (NO connection to the hotel) was outstanding for dinner. We stayed one Friday night and came back a week later for a Saturday night - the staff was very helpful with maps and reserving cars to take us to the airport early in the morning. I would certainly stay there again!

reviews.title: Excellent value, great location
reviews.text: You can't expect a 5 star hotel for this price, but it is clean and in a wondeful location. Staff very helpful and always keen to share their knowledge with you. Hotel needs renovation but at this price excellent value. If you want all the extras, pay double the price. If you want a clean, well situated hotel with limited facilities, enjoy it.

reviews.title: On target for the bargain hunter
reviews.text: I found it a great overall value. But you should know the negatives: the spartan rooms can seem pretty stark at first, they can get stuffy on a warm day, & there are no phones or clocks in the rooms or an ice machine anywhere. However, the very basic furniture is in good condition, the rooms and the baths (both private and shared) are quite clean, the staff is very friendly, and the location is fantastic (quiet area with a restaurant strip a block away that has a wide variety of good choices). It appears to attract a wide mix of young & old, straight & g/l, singles & couples, N. Americans & internationals. And the price is right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel came recommended by Lonely Planet and for the one night we stayed it was fine. The room was clean and there was a decent shower but the decor is very dated and there were numerous items which needed fixing (windows, coat-hooks etc). In short, it's OK for the price and a short stay but we'd have been a little uncomfortable if we'd had to stay any longer than one night.
reviews.title: Good Location but dated

reviews.text: The hotel is nestled on the west end of Robson St, in a beautiful neighbourhood just blocks away from Stanley Park. The hotel could use some updating but it is quite obvious that it was quite grand in its day, 1926. Guests have a choice of shared bath with three other guests for $70 or a private bath for $90 both prices are at least $50 less than any other hotels in the city. I stayed with a shared bath and never had to wait to use the shower or water closet. If you plan to use the room as a place to sleep at night you can't go wrong, it's a quiet neighbourhood where a single woman traveller like myself will feel comfortable at all times of the day. Blocks away from great restaurants and public transportation. I definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Area Great value
Horizontall laid back at the Buchan
reviews.text: Keeping in mind that this is a budget hotel it is excellent. The staff are extremely hospitable and friendly and will put themselves out for your comfort. I have stayed there a total of 6 times and plan two more visits this year. It is ideal if you are moving on up country.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great thing is that it is so close to Stanley Park and the Lost Lagoon and it is so cool, after a hard year's work to get up early, collect a coffee and miffin from Bojangles (a block away) and sit in the warm morning light overlooking the Lost Lagoon and the creatures around it. A perfect antedote.
reviews.title: A little tatty and dated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at other hotels but nothing compares to the Buchan. I don't want to spend a fortune on a hotel - I go to Canada for the tranquility and kindness of the people. I find that the large hotels are so undistinctive that you could be anywhere and after an 11 hour flight I want to know I'm yards away from Stanley Park And in a district so laid back as to be almost horizontal.
reviews.title: Nice, clean and cheap
